verses.kjv: Elihu also proceeded, and said,
verses.ct: Elihu continued and said,

verses.kjv: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God’s behalf.
verses.ct: "Be patient with me a little longer, and I'll show you that I still have more to say on God's behalf.

verses.kjv: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
verses.ct: I'll draw my understanding from far and wide, and I will declare the righteousness of my Maker.

verses.kjv: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
verses.ct: Truly, what I say will not be dishonest — someone with complete knowledge stands before you.

verses.kjv: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
verses.ct: Look, God is mighty, yet he doesn't look down on anyone. He is mighty in strength and wisdom.

verses.kjv: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.
verses.ct: He doesn't let the wicked go on living, but he grants justice to the poor.

verses.kjv: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.
verses.ct: He never takes his attention away from the righteous. He seats them with kings on thrones — yes, he establishes them permanently, and they are honored.

verses.kjv: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;
verses.ct: But if people end up bound in chains, caught in ropes of suffering,

verses.kjv: Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
verses.ct: then he reveals to them what they've done and how their sins have gotten out of control.

verses.kjv: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
verses.ct: He makes them listen to correction and commands them to turn away from their wrongdoing.

verses.kjv: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.
verses.ct: If they listen and serve him, they'll live out their days in prosperity and their years in contentment.

verses.kjv: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.
verses.ct: But if they refuse to listen, they'll die by the sword and perish without ever understanding why.

verses.kjv: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.
verses.ct: Those who are godless at heart store up anger against themselves — they don't even cry out for help when he restrains them.

verses.kjv: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.
verses.ct: They die while still young, and their lives end in disgrace.

verses.kjv: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.
verses.ct: God rescues the afflicted through their suffering and opens their ears through their oppression.

verses.kjv: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.
verses.ct: He was trying to draw you too out of your distress into an open place free from restriction, with your table loaded with rich food.

verses.kjv: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.
verses.ct: But you are consumed with the case of the wicked — judgment and justice have taken hold of you.

verses.kjv: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.
verses.ct: Be careful that anger doesn't lure you into mockery, because no amount of ransom could rescue you then.

verses.kjv: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.
verses.ct: Will your wealth be enough to save you? No — not gold, not any amount of effort or strength.

verses.kjv: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.
verses.ct: Don't long for the night, when entire peoples are swept away where they stand.

verses.kjv: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
verses.ct: Be careful not to turn toward wrongdoing, because you've been choosing that over accepting your suffering.

verses.kjv: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?
verses.ct: Look, God is exalted in his power. Who is a teacher like him?

verses.kjv: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
verses.ct: Who has ever told him what path to take? Who can say to him, 'You have done wrong'?

verses.kjv: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.
verses.ct: Remember to praise his work, which people have celebrated in song.

verses.kjv: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
verses.ct: Everyone can see it; human beings gaze at it from a distance.

verses.kjv: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
verses.ct: Look, God is great — beyond what we can understand. The number of his years is impossible to calculate.

verses.kjv: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:
verses.ct: He draws up the drops of water and distills rain from the mist he creates.

verses.kjv: Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.
verses.ct: The clouds pour it down and shower it generously on humanity.

verses.kjv: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?
verses.ct: Can anyone understand how the clouds spread out, or the thunder that rumbles from his dwelling?

verses.kjv: Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.
verses.ct: Look, he scatters his lightning across the clouds and covers the depths of the ocean.

verses.kjv: For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.
verses.ct: Through these things he governs the nations and provides food in abundance.

verses.kjv: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.
verses.ct: He fills his hands with lightning and directs it to strike its target.

verses.kjv: The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.
verses.ct: The thunder announces his coming — even the cattle sense the approaching storm."
